item.title: From Newsstand to Downtown Grand: A Vintage Look at the Lady Luck Hotel & Casino Las Vegas History
item.description:
A Most Unlikely Beginning

The story of the Lady Luck Hotel & Casino isn’t one of opulent grandeur from the start. It’s a tale of humble beginnings and a surprising transition. Believe it or not, the space that now houses the Downtown Grand (formerly Lady Luck) was initially “Honest John’s,” a combination newsstand and barber shop! This unassuming corner of the downtown core, located at 202 N Main Street, wasn’t destined for casino fame. However, in 1964, everything changed. Andy Tompkins, a visionary entrepreneur, saw potential and transformed Honest John’s into a full-fledged casino.
